bibl.title: Letter from Harry Clemons to Philip Showalter Hench, June 20, 1940

div1.p: Clemons encloses a copy of a letter from Moran to Paul B. Barringer.

div1.head: Letter from Harry Clemons to Philip Showalter Hench, June 20, 1940
div1.opener:
UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA
CHARLOTTESVILLE
ALDERMAN LIBRARY
20 June 1940
HARRY CLEMONS
LIBRARIAN
MARY LOUISE DINWIDDIE
ASSISTANT LIBRARIAN
My dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p:
We are enclosing a photoprint,
made under Mr. Wyllie's supervision, of the letter
from Mr. John J. Moran to Dr. Paul B. Barringer,
dated at Havana 6 October 1939. You will recall
that you expressed a desire to have this copy, and
we are sending it with our compliments, there being
no charge.

We greatly enjoyed your visit, and we are
keenly interested in your investigations into the
campaign against yellow fever, and in the results
which you are achieving.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, Harry Clemons
Librarian To Dr. Philip S. Hench
102-110 Second Avenue, S. W.
Rochester, Minnesota
